snippet: As dealers at Art Basel Miami Beach were counting up six- and seven-figure sales from Wednesday’s V.I.P. preview, participants in one of the satellite fairs were welcoming guests at the Catalina Hotel. The hopeful artists and gallery owners who...
abstract: As dealers at Art Basel Miami Beach were counting up six- and seven-figure sales from Wednesday’s V.I.P. preview, participants in one of the satellite fairs were welcoming guests at the Catalina Hotel. The hopeful artists and gallery owners who paid $4,000 to $5,000 to transform one of the hotel’s 64 rooms into a mini gallery, installation space or performance site had different expectations than their brethren a few blocks away.
lead_paragraph: As dealers at Art Basel Miami Beach were counting up six- and seven-figure sales from Wednesday’s V.I.P. preview, participants in one of the satellite fairs were welcoming guests at the Catalina Hotel. The hopeful artists and gallery owners who paid $4,000 to $5,000 to transform one of the hotel’s 64 rooms into a mini gallery, installation space or performance site had different expectations than their brethren a few blocks away.

headline.main: At Art Basel Miami Beach, Hopeful Artists Showing in a Hotel
